openwebui_variables.name: CHROMA_HTTP_HEADERS
openwebui_variables.description: A comma-separated list of HTTP headers to include with every ChromaDB request.

openwebui_variables.name: CHROMA_HTTP_HOST
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the hostname of a remote ChromaDB Server. Uses a local ChromaDB instance if not set.

openwebui_variables.name: CHROMA_HTTP_PORT
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the port of a remote ChromaDB Server.

openwebui_variables.name: CHROMA_HTTP_SSL
openwebui_variables.description: Controls whether or not SSL is used for ChromaDB Server connections.

openwebui_variables.name: CHROMA_TENANT
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the tenant for ChromaDB to use for RAG embeddings.

openwebui_variables.name: PGVECTOR_DB_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the database URL for model storage.

openwebui_variables.name: VECTOR_DB
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies which vector database system to use. This setting determines which vector storage system will be used for managing embeddings.

:::note

PostgreSQL Dependencies
To use `pgvector`, ensure you have PostgreSQL dependencies installed:

```bash
pip install open-webui[all]
```

:::

openwebui_variables.name: KAGI_SEARCH_API_KEY
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the API key for Kagi Search API.

openwebui_variables.name: ENABLE_MILVUS_MULTITENANCY_MODE
openwebui_variables.description:
Enables multitenancy pattern for Milvus collections management, which significantly reduces RAM usage and computational overhead by consolidating similar vector data structures. Controls whether Milvus uses multitenancy collection architecture. When enabled, all vector data is consolidated into 5 shared collections (memories, knowledge, files, web_search, hash_based) instead of creating individual collections per resource. Data isolation is achieved via a resource_id field rather than collection-level separation.

:::info

**Benefits of multitenancy mode:**

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_COLLECTION_PREFIX
openwebui_variables.description:
Sets the prefix for Milvus collection names. In multitenancy mode, collections become `{prefix}_memories`, `{prefix}_knowledge`, etc. In legacy mode, collections are `{prefix}_{collection_name}`. Changing this value creates an entirely separate namespaceâ€”existing collections with the old prefix become invisible to Open WebUI but remain in Milvus consuming resources. Use this for true multi-instance isolation on a shared Milvus server, not for migration between modes. Milvus only accepts underscores, hyphens/dashes are not possible and will cause errors.

### OpenSearch

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_DB
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database to connect to within a Milvus instance.

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_DISKANN_MAX_DEGREE
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the max degree for Milvus if Milvus is in DISKANN indexing mode. Generally recommended to leave as is.

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_DISKANN_SEARCH_LIST_SIZE
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the Milvus DISKANN search list size. Generally recommended to leave as is.

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_HNSW_EFCONSTRUCTION
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the `efConstruction` parameter for the HNSW index type in Milvus. This influences the size of the dynamic list for the nearest neighbors during index construction. Only applicable if `MILVUS_INDEX_TYPE` is `HNSW`.

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_HNSW_M
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the `M` parameter for the HNSW index type in Milvus. This influences the number of bi-directional links created for each new element during construction. Only applicable if `MILVUS_INDEX_TYPE` is `HNSW`.

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_INDEX_TYPE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the index type to use when creating a new collection in Milvus. `AUTOINDEX` is generally recommended for Milvus standalone. `HNSW` may offer better performance but requires a clustered Milvus setup and is not meant for standalone setups.

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_IVF_FLAT_NLIST
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the `nlist` parameter for the IVF_FLAT index type in Milvus. This is the number of cluster units. Only applicable if `MILVUS_INDEX_TYPE` is `IVF_FLAT`.

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_METRIC_TYPE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the metric type for vector similarity search in Milvus.

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_TOKEN
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies an optional connection token for Milvus.

openwebui_variables.name: MILVUS_URI
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the URI for connecting to the Milvus vector database. This can point to a local or remote Milvus server based on the deployment configuration.

openwebui_variables.name: PGVECTOR_DB_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the database URL for model storage.

openwebui_variables.name: VECTOR_DB
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies which vector database system to use. This setting determines which vector storage system will be used for managing embeddings.

:::note

PostgreSQL Dependencies
To use `pgvector`, ensure you have PostgreSQL dependencies installed:

```bash
pip install open-webui[all]
```

:::

### ChromaDB

openwebui_variables.name: ONEDRIVE_CLIENT_ID_BUSINESS
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies the Application (client) ID for the **Work/School (Business) OneDrive** integration. This requires a separate Azure App Registration configured to support personal Microsoft accounts. **Do not put the personal OneDrive client ID here!**

:::info

This Client ID (also known as Application ID) is obtained from an Azure App Registration within your Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure AD) tenant.
When configuring the App Registration in Azure, the Redirect URI must be set to the URL of your Open WebUI instance and configured as a **Single-page application (SPA)** type for the authentication to succeed.

:::

openwebui_variables.name: ONEDRIVE_SHAREPOINT_TENANT_ID
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the Directory (tenant) ID for the work/school integration. This is obtained from your business-focused Azure App Registration.

openwebui_variables.name: ONEDRIVE_SHAREPOINT_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the root SharePoint site URL for the work/school integration, e.g., `https://companyname.sharepoint.com`.

openwebui_variables.name: ENABLE_ONEDRIVE_INTEGRATION
openwebui_variables.description: Enables or disables the Microsoft OneDrive integration feature globally.

openwebui_variables.name: ENABLE_ONEDRIVE_PERSONAL
openwebui_variables.description: Controls whether the "Personal OneDrive" option appears in the attachment menu. Requires `ONEDRIVE_PERSONAL_CLIENT_ID` to be configured.

openwebui_variables.name: ONEDRIVE_CLIENT_ID_PERSONAL
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the Application (client) ID for the **Personal OneDrive** integration. This requires a separate Azure App Registration configured to support personal Microsoft accounts. **Do not put the business OneDrive client ID here!**

openwebui_variables.name: ENABLE_OPENAI_API
openwebui_variables.description: Enables the use of OpenAI APIs.

openwebui_variables.name: OPENAI_API_BASE_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Configures the OpenAI base API URL.

openwebui_variables.name: OPENAI_API_BASE_URLS
openwebui_variables.description: Supports balanced OpenAI base API URLs, semicolon-separated.

openwebui_variables.name: OPENAI_API_KEY
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the OpenAI API key.

openwebui_variables.name: OPENAI_API_KEYS
openwebui_variables.description: Supports multiple OpenAI API keys, semicolon-separated.

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGES_OPENAI_API_BASE_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the OpenAI-compatible base URL to use for DALL-E image generation.

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGES_OPENAI_API_KEY
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the API key to use for DALL-E image generation.

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGES_OPENAI_API_VERSION
openwebui_variables.description: Optional setting. If provided it sets the `api-version` query parameter when calling the image generation. If the Azure OpenAI service is used, this needs to be configured.

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGE_EDIT_ENGINE
openwebui_variables.description: Configures the engine used for image editing operations, enabling modification of existing images using text prompts.

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGE_EDIT_MODEL
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the model to use for image editing operations within the selected engine (e.g., dall-e-2).

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGE_EDIT_SIZE
openwebui_variables.description: Defines the output dimensions for edited images in WIDTHxHEIGHT format (e.g., 1024x1024). Leave empty to preserve original dimensions.

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGES_EDIT_OPENAI_API_BASE_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Configures the OpenAI API base URL specifically for image editing operations, allowing separate endpoints from image generation.

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGES_EDIT_OPENAI_API_VERSION
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the OpenAI API version for image editing, enabling support for Azure OpenAI deployments with versioned endpoints.

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGES_EDIT_OPENAI_API_KEY
openwebui_variables.description: Provides authentication for OpenAI image editing API requests, with support for separate keys from image generation.

openwebui_variables.name: IMAGE_GENERATION_ENGINE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the engine to use for image generation.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_EMBEDDING_ENGINE
openwebui_variables.description: Selects an embedding engine to use for RAG.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_OPENAI_API_BASE_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the OpenAI base API URL to use for RAG embeddings.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_OPENAI_API_KEY
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the OpenAI API key to use for RAG embeddings.

openwebui_variables.name: AUDIO_STT_ENGINE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the Speech-to-Text engine to use.

openwebui_variables.name: AUDIO_STT_MODEL
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the Speech-to-Text model to use for OpenAI-compatible endpoints.

openwebui_variables.name: AUDIO_STT_OPENAI_API_BASE_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the OpenAI-compatible base URL to use for Speech-to-Text.

openwebui_variables.name: AUDIO_STT_OPENAI_API_KEY
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the OpenAI API key to use for Speech-to-Text.

openwebui_variables.name: AUDIO_TTS_ENGINE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the Text-to-Speech engine to use.

openwebui_variables.name: AUDIO_TTS_MODEL
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the OpenAI text-to-speech model to use.

openwebui_variables.name: AUDIO_TTS_OPENAI_API_BASE_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the OpenAI-compatible base URL to use for text-to-speech.

openwebui_variables.name: AUDIO_TTS_OPENAI_API_KEY
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the API key to use for text-to-speech.

openwebui_variables.name: AUDIO_TTS_VOICE
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the OpenAI text-to-speech voice to use.

openwebui_variables.name: OPENSEARCH_CERT_VERIFY
openwebui_variables.description: Enables or disables OpenSearch certificate verification.

openwebui_variables.name: OPENSEARCH_PASSWORD
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the password for OpenSearch.

openwebui_variables.name: OPENSEARCH_SSL
openwebui_variables.description: Enables or disables SSL for OpenSearch.

openwebui_variables.name: OPENSEARCH_URI
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the URI for OpenSearch.

openwebui_variables.name: OPENSEARCH_USERNAME
openwebui_variables.description:
Sets the username for OpenSearch.

PostgreSQL Dependencies
To use `pgvector`, ensure you have PostgreSQL dependencies installed:

```bash
pip install open-webui[all]
```

Creates the vector extension in the database

If set to `false`, open-webui will assume the postgreSQL database where embeddings will be stored is pre-configured with the `vector` extension. This also allows open-webui to run as a non superuser database user.

openwebui_variables.name: PINECONE_DIMENSION
openwebui_variables.description: The dimensionality of the vector embeddings. Must match the dimension expected by the index (commonly 768, 1024, 1536, or 3072 based on model used).

openwebui_variables.name: PINECONE_ENVIRONMENT
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the Pinecone environment to connect to (e.g., `us-west1-gcp`, `gcp-starter`, etc.).

openwebui_variables.name: PINECONE_INDEX_NAME
openwebui_variables.description: Defines the name of the Pinecone index that will be used to store and query vector embeddings.

openwebui_variables.name: PINECONE_METRIC
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the similarity metric to use for vector comparisons within the Pinecone index.

openwebui_variables.name: VECTOR_DB
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies which vector database system to use. This setting determines which vector storage system will be used for managing embeddings.

:::note

PostgreSQL Dependencies
To use `pgvector`, ensure you have PostgreSQL dependencies installed:

```bash
pip install open-webui[all]
```

:::

### ChromaDB

openwebui_variables.name: PLAYWRIGHT_TIMEOUT
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the timeout for Playwright requests.

openwebui_variables.name: PLAYWRIGHT_WS_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the WebSocket URI of a remote Playwright browser instance. When set, Open WebUI will use this remote browser instead of installing browser dependencies locally. This is particularly useful in containerized environments where you want to keep the Open WebUI container lightweight and separate browser concerns. Example: `ws://playwright:3000`

openwebui_variables.name: WEB_LOADER_ENGINE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the loader to use for retrieving and processing web content.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_HOST
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the hostname or IP address of the database server. This is used to construct the `DATABASE_URL` when a complete `DATABASE_URL` is not explicitly defined.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_PASSWORD
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the password for database authentication. This is used to construct the `DATABASE_URL` when a complete `DATABASE_URL` is not explicitly defined. If your password contains special characters, please ensure they are properly URL-encoded.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_TYPE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database type (e.g., `sqlite`, `postgresql`, `sqlite+sqlcipher`). This is used in conjunction with other individual parameters to construct the `DATABASE_URL` if a complete `DATABASE_URL` is not explicitly defined.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_URL
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies the complete database connection URL, following SQLAlchemy's URL scheme. This variable takes precedence over individual database connection parameters if explicitly set.

:::info

**For PostgreSQL support, ensure you installed with `pip install open-webui[all]` instead of the basic installation.**
Supports SQLite, Postgres, and encrypted SQLite via SQLCipher.
**Changing the URL does not migrate data between databases.**

Documentation on the URL scheme is available [here](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/engines.html#database-urls).

If your database password contains special characters, please ensure they are properly URL-encoded. For example, a password like `p@ssword` should be encoded as `p%40ssword`.

For configuration using individual parameters or encrypted SQLite, see the relevant sections below.

:::

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_USER
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the username for database authentication. This is used to construct the `DATABASE_URL` when a complete `DATABASE_URL` is not explicitly defined.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_PORT
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the port number of the database server. This is used to construct the DATABASE_URL when a complete DATABASE_URL is not explicitly defined.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_NAME
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the name of the database to connect to. This is used to construct the DATABASE_URL when a complete DATABASE_URL is not explicitly defined.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_SCHEMA
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database schema to connect to.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_SIZE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the pooling strategy and size of the database pool. By default SQLAlchemy will automatically chose the proper pooling strategy for the selected database connection. A value of 0 disables pooling. A value larger 0 will set the pooling strategy to QueuePool and the pool size accordingly.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_MAX_OVERFLOW
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database pool max overflow. More information: https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/pooling.html#sqlalchemy.pool.QueuePool.params.max_overflow

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_TIMEOUT
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database pool timeout in seconds to get a connection. More information: https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/pooling.html#sqlalchemy.pool.QueuePool.params.timeout

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_RECYCLE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database pool recycle time in seconds. More information: https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/pooling.html#setting-pool-recycle

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_ENABLE_SQLITE_WAL
openwebui_variables.description: Enables or disables SQLite WAL (Write-Ahead Logging) mode. When enabled, SQLite transactions can be managed more efficiently, allowing multiple readers and one writer concurrently, which can improve database performance, especially under high concurrency. This setting only applies to SQLite databases.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_DEDUPLICATE_INTERVAL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets a time interval in seconds during which certain database write operations (e.g., updating a user's last_active_at timestamp) will be deduplicated. If a write operation is attempted within this interval for the same entity, it will be skipped. A value of 0.0 disables deduplication.

openwebui_variables.name: CODE_EXECUTION_ENGINE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the code execution engine to use.

openwebui_variables.name: CODE_INTERPRETER_ENGINE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the code interpreter engine to use.

openwebui_variables.name: ENABLE_QDRANT_MULTITENANCY_MODE
openwebui_variables.description:
Enables multitenancy pattern for Qdrant collections management, which significantly reduces RAM usage and computational overhead by consolidating similar vector data structures. Recommend turn on

:::info

This will disconect all Qdrant collections created in the previous pattern, which is non-multitenancy. Go to  `Admin Settings` > `Documents` > `Reindex Knowledge Base` to migrate existing knowledges.

The Qdrant collections created in the previous pattern will still consume resources.

Currently, there is no button in the UI to only reset the vector DB. If you want to migrate knowledge to multitenancy:

openwebui_variables.name: PGVECTOR_DB_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the database URL for model storage.

openwebui_variables.name: QDRANT_API_KEY
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the API key for Qdrant.

openwebui_variables.name: QDRANT_COLLECTION_PREFIX
openwebui_variables.description:
Sets the prefix for Qdrant collection names. Useful for namespacing or isolating collections, especially in multitenancy mode. Changing this value will cause the application to use a different set of collections in Qdrant. Existing collections with a different prefix will not be affected.

### Pinecone

When using Pinecone as the vector store, the following environment variables are used to control its behavior. Make sure to set these variables in your `.env` file or deployment environment.

openwebui_variables.name: QDRANT_GRPC_PORT
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the gRPC port number for Qdrant.

openwebui_variables.name: QDRANT_HNSW_M
openwebui_variables.description: Controls the HNSW (Hierarchical Navigable Small World) index construction. In standard mode, this sets the `m` parameter. In multi-tenancy mode, this value is used for the `payload_m` parameter to build indexes on the payload, as the global `m` is disabled for performance, following Qdrant best practices.

openwebui_variables.name: QDRANT_ON_DISK
openwebui_variables.description: Enable the usage of memmap(also known as on-disk) storage

openwebui_variables.name: QDRANT_PREFER_GRPC
openwebui_variables.description:
Use gPRC interface whenever possible.

:::info

If set to `True`, and `QDRANT_URI` points to a self-hosted server with TLS enabled and certificate signed by a private CA, set the environment variable `GRPC_DEFAULT_SSL_ROOTS_FILE_PATH` to the path of your PEM-encoded CA certificates file. See the [gRPC Core Docs](https://grpc.github.io/grpc/core/md_doc_environment_variables.html) for more information.

:::

openwebui_variables.name: QDRANT_TIMEOUT
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the timeout in seconds for all requests made to the Qdrant server, helping to prevent long-running queries from stalling the application.

openwebui_variables.name: QDRANT_URI
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the URI for Qdrant.

openwebui_variables.name: VECTOR_DB
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies which vector database system to use. This setting determines which vector storage system will be used for managing embeddings.

:::note

PostgreSQL Dependencies
To use `pgvector`, ensure you have PostgreSQL dependencies installed:

```bash
pip install open-webui[all]
```

:::

### ChromaDB

services.name: RAG Shared Settings
services.description: Shared configuration for RAG functionality, automatically available when any vector database is configured

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_TOP_K
openwebui_variables.description: Number of documents to retrieve during RAG queries.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_TOP_K_RERANKER
openwebui_variables.description: Number of documents to consider after reranking.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_RELEVANCE_THRESHOLD
openwebui_variables.description: Minimum relevance score threshold for retrieved documents.

openwebui_variables.name: ENABLE_RAG_HYBRID_SEARCH
openwebui_variables.description: Enable hybrid search combining BM25 keyword search with vector similarity search.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_HYBRID_BM25_WEIGHT
openwebui_variables.description: Weight for BM25 in hybrid search (0-1). 1 means only keyword search, 0 means only vector search.

openwebui_variables.name: CHUNK_SIZE
openwebui_variables.description: Document chunk size in characters for embeddings.

openwebui_variables.name: CHUNK_OVERLAP
openwebui_variables.description: Overlap between consecutive chunks in characters.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_TEXT_SPLITTER
openwebui_variables.description: Text splitter algorithm to use for document chunking.

openwebui_variables.name: TIKTOKEN_CACHE_DIR
openwebui_variables.description: Directory for TikToken cache storage.

openwebui_variables.name: TIKTOKEN_ENCODING_NAME
openwebui_variables.description: TikToken encoding name to use.

openwebui_variables.name: PDF_EXTRACT_IMAGES
openwebui_variables.description: Extract images from PDFs using OCR when loading documents.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_FILE_MAX_SIZE
openwebui_variables.description: Maximum file size in megabytes for document upload.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_FILE_MAX_COUNT
openwebui_variables.description: Maximum number of files that can be uploaded at once.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_ALLOWED_FILE_EXTENSIONS
openwebui_variables.description: List of allowed file extensions for upload. Empty list allows all supported types.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_EMBEDDING_BATCH_SIZE
openwebui_variables.description: Batch size for embedding generation in RAG models.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_RERANKING_MODEL
openwebui_variables.description: Model to use for reranking retrieved results (e.g., cross-encoder model).

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_RERANKING_MODEL_TRUST_REMOTE_CODE
openwebui_variables.description: Trust remote code for reranking model from HuggingFace Hub.

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_RERANKING_MODEL_AUTO_UPDATE
openwebui_variables.description: Automatically update reranking model when newer version available.

openwebui_variables.name: ENABLE_RETRIEVAL_QUERY_GENERATION
openwebui_variables.description: Enable AI-powered query optimization for better retrieval results.

openwebui_variables.name: BYPASS_EMBEDDING_AND_RETRIEVAL
openwebui_variables.description: Bypass embedding and retrieval process (for testing only).

openwebui_variables.name: RAG_FULL_CONTEXT
openwebui_variables.description: Use full document context instead of chunked retrieval.

openwebui_variables.name: ENABLE_RAG_LOCAL_WEB_FETCH
openwebui_variables.description: Enable local web content fetching for RAG.

openwebui_variables.name: REDIS_KEY_PREFIX
openwebui_variables.description: Customizes the Redis key prefix used for storing configuration values. This allows multiple Open WebUI instances to share the same Redis instance without key conflicts. When operating in Redis cluster mode, the prefix is formatted as `{prefix}:` (e.g., `{open-webui}:config:*`) to enable multi-key operations on configuration keys within the same hash slot.

openwebui_variables.name: REDIS_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the URL of the Redis instance or cluster host for storing application state.

openwebui_variables.name: WEBSOCKET_REDIS_URL
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies the URL of the Redis instance or cluster host for websocket communication. It is distinct from `REDIS_URL` and in practice, it is recommended to set both.

:::info

When deploying Open WebUI in a multi-node/worker cluster with a load balancer, you must ensure that the WEBSOCKET_REDIS_URL value is set and a key-value NoSQL database like Redis is used. Without it, websocket consistency and persistency issues will occur.

:::

openwebui_variables.name: REDIS_CLUSTER
openwebui_variables.description:
Connect to a Redis Cluster instead of a single instance or using Redis Sentinels. If `True`, `REDIS_URL` must also be defined.

:::info

This option has no effect if `REDIS_SENTINEL_HOSTS` is defined.

:::

openwebui_variables.name: REDIS_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the URL of the Redis instance or cluster host for storing application state.

openwebui_variables.name: WEBSOCKET_REDIS_CLUSTER
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies that websocket should communicate with a Redis Cluster instead of a single instance or using Redis Sentinels. If `True`, `WEBSOCKET_REDIS_URL` and/or `REDIS_URL` must also be defined.

:::info

This option has no effect if `WEBSOCKET_SENTINEL_HOSTS` is defined.

:::

openwebui_variables.name: WEBSOCKET_REDIS_URL
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies the URL of the Redis instance or cluster host for websocket communication. It is distinct from `REDIS_URL` and in practice, it is recommended to set both.

:::info

When deploying Open WebUI in a multi-node/worker cluster with a load balancer, you must ensure that the WEBSOCKET_REDIS_URL value is set and a key-value NoSQL database like Redis is used. Without it, websocket consistency and persistency issues will occur.

:::

openwebui_variables.name: REDIS_SENTINEL_HOSTS
openwebui_variables.description: Comma-separated list of Redis Sentinels for app state. If specified, the "hostname" in `REDIS_URL` will be interpreted as the Sentinel service name.

openwebui_variables.name: REDIS_SENTINEL_PORT
openwebui_variables.description: Sentinel port for app state Redis.

openwebui_variables.name: S3_ACCESS_KEY_ID
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the access key ID for S3 storage.

openwebui_variables.name: S3_BUCKET_NAME
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the bucket name for S3 storage.

openwebui_variables.name: S3_ENDPOINT_URL
openwebui_variables.description:
Sets the endpoint URL for S3 storage.

:::info

If the endpoint is an S3-compatible provider like MinIO that uses a TLS certificate signed by a private CA, set the environment variable `AWS_CA_BUNDLE` to the path of your PEM-encoded CA certificates file. See the [Amazon SDK Docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdkref/latest/guide/feature-gen-config.html) for more information.

:::

openwebui_variables.name: S3_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the secret access key for S3 storage.

openwebui_variables.name: S3_KEY_PREFIX
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the key prefix for a S3 object.

openwebui_variables.name: S3_USE_ACCELERATE_ENDPOINT
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies whether to use the accelerated endpoint for S3 storage.

openwebui_variables.name: S3_ENABLE_TAGGING
openwebui_variables.description: Enables S3 object tagging. Set to False for Cloudflare R2.

openwebui_variables.name: S3_ADDRESSING_STYLE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the addressing style to use for S3 storage (e.g., 'path', 'virtual').

openwebui_variables.name: S3_REGION_NAME
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the region name for S3 storage.

openwebui_variables.name: STORAGE_PROVIDER
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the storage provider.

openwebui_variables.name: PGVECTOR_DB_URL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets the database URL for model storage.

openwebui_variables.name: S3_VECTOR_BUCKET_NAME
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the name of the S3 Vector Bucket to store vectors in.

openwebui_variables.name: S3_VECTOR_REGION
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies the AWS region where the S3 Vector Bucket is hosted.

## RAG Content Extraction Engine

openwebui_variables.name: VECTOR_DB
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies which vector database system to use. This setting determines which vector storage system will be used for managing embeddings.

:::note

PostgreSQL Dependencies
To use `pgvector`, ensure you have PostgreSQL dependencies installed:

```bash
pip install open-webui[all]
```

:::

### ChromaDB

openwebui_variables.name: SOUGOU_API_SK

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_PASSWORD
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the password for database authentication. This is used to construct the `DATABASE_URL` when a complete `DATABASE_URL` is not explicitly defined. If your password contains special characters, please ensure they are properly URL-encoded.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_TYPE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database type (e.g., `sqlite`, `postgresql`, `sqlite+sqlcipher`). This is used in conjunction with other individual parameters to construct the `DATABASE_URL` if a complete `DATABASE_URL` is not explicitly defined.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_SIZE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the pooling strategy and size of the database pool. By default SQLAlchemy will automatically chose the proper pooling strategy for the selected database connection. A value of 0 disables pooling. A value larger 0 will set the pooling strategy to QueuePool and the pool size accordingly.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_MAX_OVERFLOW
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database pool max overflow. More information: https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/pooling.html#sqlalchemy.pool.QueuePool.params.max_overflow

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_TIMEOUT
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database pool timeout in seconds to get a connection. More information: https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/pooling.html#sqlalchemy.pool.QueuePool.params.timeout

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_RECYCLE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database pool recycle time in seconds. More information: https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/pooling.html#setting-pool-recycle

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_ENABLE_SQLITE_WAL
openwebui_variables.description: Enables or disables SQLite WAL (Write-Ahead Logging) mode. When enabled, SQLite transactions can be managed more efficiently, allowing multiple readers and one writer concurrently, which can improve database performance, especially under high concurrency. This setting only applies to SQLite databases.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_DEDUPLICATE_INTERVAL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets a time interval in seconds during which certain database write operations (e.g., updating a user's last_active_at timestamp) will be deduplicated. If a write operation is attempted within this interval for the same entity, it will be skipped. A value of 0.0 disables deduplication.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_TYPE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database type (e.g., `sqlite`, `postgresql`, `sqlite+sqlcipher`). This is used in conjunction with other individual parameters to construct the `DATABASE_URL` if a complete `DATABASE_URL` is not explicitly defined.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_URL
openwebui_variables.description:
Specifies the complete database connection URL, following SQLAlchemy's URL scheme. This variable takes precedence over individual database connection parameters if explicitly set.

:::info

**For PostgreSQL support, ensure you installed with `pip install open-webui[all]` instead of the basic installation.**
Supports SQLite, Postgres, and encrypted SQLite via SQLCipher.
**Changing the URL does not migrate data between databases.**

Documentation on the URL scheme is available [here](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/engines.html#database-urls).

If your database password contains special characters, please ensure they are properly URL-encoded. For example, a password like `p@ssword` should be encoded as `p%40ssword`.

For configuration using individual parameters or encrypted SQLite, see the relevant sections below.

:::

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_SIZE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the pooling strategy and size of the database pool. By default SQLAlchemy will automatically chose the proper pooling strategy for the selected database connection. A value of 0 disables pooling. A value larger 0 will set the pooling strategy to QueuePool and the pool size accordingly.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_MAX_OVERFLOW
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database pool max overflow. More information: https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/pooling.html#sqlalchemy.pool.QueuePool.params.max_overflow

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_TIMEOUT
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database pool timeout in seconds to get a connection. More information: https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/pooling.html#sqlalchemy.pool.QueuePool.params.timeout

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_POOL_RECYCLE
openwebui_variables.description: Specifies the database pool recycle time in seconds. More information: https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/core/pooling.html#setting-pool-recycle

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_ENABLE_SQLITE_WAL
openwebui_variables.description: Enables or disables SQLite WAL (Write-Ahead Logging) mode. When enabled, SQLite transactions can be managed more efficiently, allowing multiple readers and one writer concurrently, which can improve database performance, especially under high concurrency. This setting only applies to SQLite databases.

openwebui_variables.name: DATABASE_DEDUPLICATE_INTERVAL
openwebui_variables.description: Sets a time interval in seconds during which certain database write operations (e.g., updating a user's last_active_at timestamp) will be deduplicated. If a write operation is attempted within this interval for the same entity, it will be skipped. A value of 0.0 disables deduplication.
